docblock.description: "Audero Wav Extractor" is a PHP library that allows to extract a chunk from a wav file.
docblock.long-description:
The extracted chunk of the wav file can be saved on the hard disk, can be forced to be prompted as download by the user's browser, returned as a string for a later processing or a combination of the first and second possibilities. It is very easy to use "Audero Wav Extractor" to extract a piece of audio from a wav file. All you have to do is give the name of the file, the start and the end time to extract (optionally you can provide a name for the extracted chunk).

LICENSE: "Audero Wav Extractor" (from now on "The software") is released under the CC BY-NC 3.0 ("Creative Commons Attribution NonCommercial 3.0") license. More details can be found here: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/3.0/

WARRANTY: The software is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and noninfringement. In no event shall the authors or copyright holders be liable for any claim, damages or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort or otherwise, arising from, out of or in connection with the software or the use or other dealings in the software.

docblock.description: Extract a portion of the current, from the $start to $end.
docblock.long-description:
The chunk will be saved, with name $filename, in the local server, the browser or the user and so on based on the value of $Destination.

The possible value of $Destination are:

  • 1: send the file to the browser and force the download with the name given by $filename.
  • 2: save into the local disk the file with the name given by $filename.
  • 3: return the wav as a string. In this case $filename is ignored.
  • 4: both 2 and 3

tag.name: param
tag.description: The start time, in milliseconds, of the portion to extract

tag.name: param
tag.description: The end time, in milliseconds, of the portion to extract

tag.name: param
tag.description: Where to save the extracted chunk

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$filename The name to assign to the chunk. If no name is provided the method generate one using this rule: "InputFilename-Start-End.wav"

tag.name: return
tag.description: The chunk to extract, including the headers

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If the give boundary is invalid (for example if the end is lower than start) or if the destination value isn't valid (for example greater than 4).

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If there's not enough memory to save the given range

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: Since version 2.0.0

docblock.description: Extract a portion of the current, from the $start to $end and return it as a string

tag.description: The end time, in milliseconds, of the portion to extract

tag.name: return
tag.description: The chunk to extract, including the headers

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If the give boundary is invalid (for example if the end is lower than start) or if the destination value isn't valid (for example greater than 4).

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If there's not enough memory to save the given range

tag.name: throws

docblock.description: Try to test if the available memory is enough to extract the chunk

tag.name: param
tag.description: The end time, in milliseconds, of the chunk that has to be extracted

tag.description: true if the memory is enough. false otherwise.

docblock.description: This is a generic class which represents a chunk.
docblock.long-description:
Every chunk which a wav file is composed of, has common features and that is a unique id for its type and a size. Thus in Audero Wav Extractor library every chunk extends this generic class that contains a set of methods which are valid and useful for every extended class.

LICENSE: "Audero Wav Extractor" (from now on "The software") is released under the CC BY-NC 3.0 ("Creative Commons Attribution NonCommercial 3.0") license. More details can be found here: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/3.0/

In no event shall the authors or copyright holders be liable for any claim, damages or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort or otherwise, arising from, out of or in connection with the software or the use or other dealings in the software.

docblock.description: This class represents the value of a chunk.
docblock.long-description:
Although a value in the chunks is always a string, which of course can also represent an integer, I created a whole class to keep track of other info about the value. In fact, every value has potentially a different format (used by pack and unpack function of PHP to extract the value - more info here: http://php.net/manual/en/function.pack.php) and size (in bytes).

LICENSE: "Audero Wav Extractor" (from now on "The software") is released under the CC BY-NC 3.0 ("Creative Commons Attribution NonCommercial 3.0") license. More details can be found here: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/3.0/

WARRANTY: The software is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose and noninfringement.
